title: So F@kin Tired of These Damn Robots
body:
Why do people act like they cant think for themselves. They think there is only 1 way to play this game?

just went through a champ selection where our Top had to dodge in a ranked game just because he wanted to top Shaco. 

He was locked in and the other 3 people on our team told him they were going to report him unsportsmanlike........just because he was top shaco? wtf

So he dodged.

They wanted him to be a tank. This is what the game has become. People are stuck in this robotic way of thinking there is only one way to play this game. So when they see something different they are quick to report.  

I bet if the game went on and this Shaco carried their a$$es they would be sitting there with that di@k face looking stupid.

Edit: For those of you wanting more "context" this guy was 1st pick and locked in. So there was no "pick what the team needs" option. There are 2 other spots to have your tanks if you feel you NEED one. support and jungle.

People act like they have never won a game without a tank before....or that they cant play a untanky champ tanky.

If you feel that way you should see my Hiemer top lane build....its a tank build and i just walk around my turrets while people attack me thinking they will kill me quick all awhile my turrets are killing them. Then i dance a headspin on their dead bodies.

replies.body: He didn't need to dodge, he should have screenshotted and sent in a support ticket. Don't EVER fear unjustified reports.
if he didn't dodge his team would have tilted. They were already going in to a game with a negative attitude. Dodging = 1-5 lp lost, losing game = 10-30 (or however much)

Call it a sense of Justice, but I personally don't dodge when threatened in queue. I don't blame anyone that does dodge, but for me, I can sacrifice some LP to report those people. I don't want players like that to feel like they can just get away with that behavior. That they can be bullies and the community will just bend over for them.

Getting that message from Riot saying someone has been banned thanks to my reports makes me Kreygasm.
True....but he did dodge and lost LP because of their threats and i just thought it was complete BS.

There's nothing wrong with Shaco Top if you have a team that can support that. If I see a Shaco top and our Jungler isn't a Tank, then I'll take a Tank support. If I see a Shaco top and our Support isn't a Tank, then I'll take a Tank jungler. It's not that complicated. That's the team not having flexible players. It's not report worthy.

Some people try to only stick with one champion and will play them in either role they picked as options. If I see a Shaco top, I'd assume he went Top/Jungle and got Top. It's not troll. It's a guy that probably plays his best game with Shaco. Do I really want this guy playing a Tank champion he isn't as good with and will possibly lose lane hard so I have to deal with a Fed enemy top laner while having a tank that is so far behind that they are useless in team fights?

I think you misspelled sheep.

Trust me, even if you pick "meta" picks and don't play or build a certain way, they'd flame you anyways.
I got flamed for building Veigar without Void Staff once.... enemy team had built exactly zero MR beside the tank.
Ive seen this done. The shaco did well, so his team started trollling so they wouldnt be carried by a "trollpick". Ridiculous.

Sorry, but I'd probably report him too for top Shaco. It's a troll pick, especially in ranked play. If you gonna play Shaco, then play him jungle. It's no different than taking Janna jungle in ranked. It shouldn't happen. His intended role is jungle, his best role is jungle.

I would prefer a tank myself, or an actual top laner.

Any champion can be a "troll pick".  All that is required is that the player intends to troll.

There is no such thing as a champion who is a troll pick if the player does not intend to troll.  People thinking like this are part of the reason trying "different" things is frowned upon.

If you practice a non-meta champion to the point where you are willing to play them in ranked you should be allowed to do it, and anyone who threatens you over it should receive harsher than normal punishments.  That's just my opinion of course, they would likely just receive regular punishments.

So yeah, a  blind squirrel finds a nut every now and then, that shouldn't convince you that there isn't anything wrong with that picture.  A Janna jungle is a troll pick. So yeah, Shaco top is a troll pick. Normally Shaco top is supposed to be the off meta fun picks, nothing serious. Keep that pout of ranked. I don't care if you are master level 5, and will try, the chances are still low. 

I love how you guys disagree with facts. That's the thing I never understood about the gaming community and disagreements mostly on the internet is that people refuse to agree.

I saw an AP caitlyn and an AP lucian do well before. Do I think those are good builds for them? No. But I'm going to reserve judgment til after the game, how they did, and how they ACTED which I think is most important. So long as they actually try, I don't really care what you're trying out so long as your build actually scales with your kit, or work in some other way.

Sometimes people do try to do well, but at the same time try to provoke people into reacting. They can't be punished but those that react can.

You can do these type of things presently and not be banned.

I just watched a bit of that video, and many of his team mates were raging at him before the game even started. Heck, at high elos roaming support is basically what you do anyway, roam during opportune times to gank other lanes.

People were raging at him pretty much the whole time when he was doing well, and wasn't actively yelling at them or anything of the sort. To be frank, his team mates seemed more toxic than he was.
So it's ok for me to go duo jgl and smite all the things the jgler wants, and make him pissed as long as I act like he does?

He stated right in the lobby what his intentions were. His team mates would get mad, even though everyone else would get fed.

Supports roam in high ratings anyway. They are supposed to support their bot lane and roam when they have spare time, he opted to just roam. There's nothing wrong with that if you're trying your best and finding success in it, which he was.

The only people being toxic were his team mates.

I'm not intentionally hurting. I'm not trying to hurt, I'm trying to share xp and get buffs, that way we can coordinate ganks or split off and gank two lanes.

Janna is purposefully screwing over bot lane ADC by forcingher to 1v2, letting her get shat on by opponents, lose Xp, and have a unpleasant experience.

No, because you'd be intentionally hurting your team mate. What you're suggesting is the idea of being able to purposefully screw your team over, and be okay for it so long as you don't say anything.

And I think that's where our misunderstanding / disagreement is. Because that janna isn't purposefully screwing over anyone. He's not stealing kills, CS, preventing people being able to play, etc. Why can't he roam? This quite literally happens at top levels of play anyway.
